avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Unstable windslab will persist in wind sheltered locations on West through North to North-East aspects above 900 metres. Gully tops, sharply defined corrie rims and similar wind sheltered features will be worst affected. Fragile cornices will be present on these aspects. Elsewhere the snow will be shallow or well bonded and wind scoured.  The avalanche hazard will be Moderate.
avalancheActivity.highlights: SC 17/02/25 Unstable windslab, wind sheltered locations, W, NW, N, NE aspects abv 900m. Cornices present. Avalanche hazard Moderate.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Mostly dry with just a trace of snow forecast above 300 metres during the afternoon. Strong South-South-Easterly winds throughout. Freezing level around 400 metres.
Observed Weather Influences: Snow showers on near gale force South-South-Easterly winds. Freezing level around 600 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: Fresh unstable windslab is rapidly forming in wind sheltered locations on West through North to North-East aspect above 900 metres. Both depth and distribution have increased with features such as gully tops, sharply defined corrie rims and steep convex slopes affected. Fragile cornices are forming on these aspects. Elsewhere the snow is either shallow or well bonded.  The avalanche hazard is Moderate.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Isolated areas of unstable windslab will persist, mainly on West to North aspects above 900 metres. There will also be fresh deposits of windslab as snow is redistributed. Other aspects will be affected by cross-loading. Areas most affected will be gully tops and ridge flanks. Otherwise the snowpack will be shallow and generally stable. The avalanche hazard will be Moderate.
avalancheActivity.highlights: LO for 17/02/25 Unstable windslab on W-N above 900m, gully tops most affected.  Elsewhere, shallow and stable. Moderate Hazard.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: A dry day is expected with summit temperatures around -6 degrees. Fresh to strong South-East winds will continue into the evening, then back East-South-East overnight becoming strong to gale force by the end of the period.
Observed Weather Influences: It was a dry day with very strong to gale force South-East winds. The freezing level was around 650 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: Isolated accumulations of unstable windslab persist, mainly on West to North aspects above 900 metres. Elsewhere, the snowpack is shallow and generally stable.  The avalanche hazard is Low.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Snowpack stability will generally remain good. Isolated areas of windslab may exist in wind sheltered areas such as summit gullies and corrie rims; these areas are expected to  be shallow and avoidable. Greatest accumulations of snow will remain on North to East aspects above 800 metres.  The avalanche hazard will be Low.
avalancheActivity.highlights: GC17/1 Dry, fresh ESE winds snowpack icy in places, isolated shallow windslab summit gullies+corrie rims Avalanche Hazard Low.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Dry  conditions will continue to affect the area. Winds will be fresh, occasionally strong, generally East-South-Easterly. The freezing level will be around 800 metres.
Observed Weather Influences: Sunday was mainly dry with fresh to strong generally South-Easterly winds. The freezing level was around 700 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: Snowpack stability is generally good. The few isolated, shallow deposits of windslab that persist on high North-West to North-East aspects are well bonded. A breakable crust exists in many locations, with the snow surface firm and icy in other areas.  The avalanche hazard is Low.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: The snowpack will be generally stable and firm in most locations. However, isolated shallow pockets of unstable windslab will remain on steep West to North aspects above 950 metres, mostly confined to coire rims and gully exits. Cold induced instabilities will persist, primarily on steep North to East aspects above 950 metres. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
avalancheActivity.highlights: CM for 17.2. Snowpack mostly stable and firm. Isolated instabilities on W, NW, N, NE, E above 950m.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: A dry day with moderate to fresh South-Easterly winds. The freezing level will hover around 600 metres.
Observed Weather Influences: A dry day with fresh to strong South-Easterly winds. The freezing level was around 600 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: Generally good stability in most locations. Isolated shallow pockets of unstable windslab on steep West to North aspects above 950 metres, mainly around coire rims and gully exits. Some cold induced instabilities are present, primarily on steep North to East aspects above 900 metres. The avalanche hazard is Low.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: The patchy snow cover will remain firm and stable in all locations. Greatest snow cover will be mostly in mountain areas inland from the coastal ranges and on Northerly to Easterly aspects above 750 metres. Snow will be mainly confined to coire rims, ridge flanks and gullies. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
avalancheActivity.highlights: TO 17/2. Dry with light to moderate Easterly winds. Patchy snow remaining firm and stable. Low Hazard.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: It will be dry and cloudy throughout the period. Light Easterly winds only increasing slightly through the day. The freezing level will be around 400 metres.
Observed Weather Influences: A dry, bright and mainly sunny day. Moderate to fresh Easterly winds. The freezing level was around 600 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: The patchy snow cover is firm and stable in all locations. Overnight rime and frost forming at higher elevations. Greatest snow cover is mostly in mountain areas inland from the coastal ranges and on Northerly to Easterly aspects above 750 metres. Snow is mainly confined to coire rims, ridge flanks and gullies. The avalanche hazard is Low.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Unstable windslab will become more widespread on West through North to North-East aspects above 900 metres. Areas most affected will be steep wind sheltered locations such as coire rims, gullies and crag aprons. At lower elevations some isolated drifts will be present due to the strong winds. Fragile cornices will also continue to develop. Elsewhere the snowpack will be very firm and stable, while slopes exposed to the wind will continue to be scoured. The avalanche hazard will be Moderate.
avalancheActivity.highlights: NC for 17.2. Windslab becoming more widespread. W,NW,N,NE aspects above 900 m. Avalanche Hazard Moderate.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: A dry day is expected. Winds will be from the South-South-East, initially strong, increasing to give gale force gusts by the end of the period. The freezing level will fluctuate between 600 and 700 metres.
Observed Weather Influences: Light snow showers quickly dissipated in the morning, giving a dry afternoon. Winds were strong to gale force and mainly from the South-South-East. The freezing level was around 600 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: Moderately bonded windslab continues to develop on West through North to North-East aspects above 900 metres. The greatest instability is found in steep and convex wind sheltered locations such as coire rims, gullies and crag aprons. Fragile cornices are also present. Elsewhere the old snowpack is very firm and stable. Plateau areas are scoured. The avalanche hazard is Moderate.
